org.phantomapi.construct

Interface Controllable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ControllerMessenger, org.bukkit.event.Listener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AsyncDataController, BlockCheckController, BlockUpdateController, BungeeController, CacheController, ChanneledExecutivePoolController, CommandController, CommandRegistryController, CommandSupportController, ConfigurableController, ConfigurationBackupController, ControllableEnvironment, ControllablePlugin, Controller, CTNController, DataController, DefaultController, DevelopmentController, DMS, EditSessionController, EventRippler, ExtensionLibrary, Ghost, HotLoadController, HyveController, KernelController, LanguageController, MonitorController, MultiblockRegistryController, MySQLConnectionController, NestController, NotificationController, Phantom, PhantomGamePlugin, PhantomPlugin, PhastController, PhotonController, PlayerDataHandler, PlayerDataManager, PlayerTagController, PPAController, ProbeController, ProtocolController, RebootController, RedisConnectionController, RegistryController, ResourceController, SlateController, SpawnerController, SQLiteConnectionController, TestController, UpdateController, WorldController, WraithController, ZenithController

    public interface Controllable
extends org.bukkit.event.Listener, ControllerMessenger
    Controllable object. A controllable object has several functions that make it truly controllable.
    • A Controllable object can be started, stopped, and ticked with the @Ticked annotation
    • A Controllable object must have a parent controller unless it is a controllable plugin
    • A Controllable object can contain sub controllers which must be started before this controller starts

    Author:
    cyberpwn

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
        Start the controller. This starts all sub controllers first before starting itself. Do not override this unless you know what you are doing. Override the onStart()

      • getDispatcher

        D getDispatcher()
        Get the dispatcher of this controller
        Returns:
        the dispatcher

      • getTime

        double getTime()
        Get MS time on cpu. Returns the milliseconds used for ticking and starting this controller
        Returns:
        time on cpu.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stop the controller. Stops the controller by disabling all sub controllers, then stopping itself after. Do not override this unless you know what you are doing. Override the onStop method

      • loadSqLite

        void loadSqLite(Configurable c,
                File file)
        Load the sqlite data into the cluster
        Parameters:
        c - the configurable object
        file - the file

      • saveSqLite

        void saveSqLite(Configurable c,
                File file)
        Save cluster data into the sqlite db
        Parameters:
        c - the cluster
        file - the sqlite db

      • closeSqLite

        void closeSqLite(File file)
        Close and unlock the sqlite file
        Parameters:
        file - the file

      • loadMysql

        void loadMysql(Configurable c,
               Runnable finish)
        Load mysql data into the given cluster
        Parameters:
        c - the cluster
        finish - when its done

      • loadMysql

        void loadMysql(Configurable c)
        Load the mysql data into the given cluster
        Parameters:
        c - the cluster

      • saveMysql

        void saveMysql(Configurable c)
        Save cluster data into the mysql db
        Parameters:
        c - the cluster

      • saveMysql

        void saveMysql(Configurable c,
               Runnable finish)
        Save cluster data into the mysql db
        Parameters:
        c - the cluster
        finish - when its done

      • reload

        void reload()
        Reload the controller and all subcontrollers. Simply calls stop(), then start() following the process of controller structure. Before this happens, onReload is called.

      • unregister

        void unregister(Controllable c)
        Unregister the controller. Unregisters the controller from this controller and phantom, along with any other post controller processing done on setup
        Parameters:
        c - the controller to be unregistered from this controller and phantom

      • onReload

        void onReload()
        Called when a controller is reloading (all sub controllers will reload)

      • tick

        void tick()
        Tick the controler. This is called by a phantom provider in the plugin holding this controller. To get this to fire, either tick it, or use @Ticked(interval) on this class

      • onStart

        void onStart()
        Override for start. Called when this controller is starting up. This could be called async. If you need it sync, either use S.class, or annotate @SyncStart for this class

      • onStop

        void onStop()
        Override for stop. Called when the controller is stopping (likley a plugin disable)

      • onTick

        void onTick()
        Override for ticking. Called when the phantom provider has decided to tick this plugin or tick was called

      • isTicked

        boolean isTicked()
        Should this controller be ticking. If this controller has @Ticked() on the type, it will return true
        Returns:
        true if its ticked

      • onPreStart

        void onPreStart()
        Called before onstart. This is called before the controller has started but after it has been initialized

      • onPostStop

        void onPostStop()
        Called after onstop. This is called for any last minute things that need to be done. You cannot schedule tasks here (they would die before they start)

      • onLoadComplete

        void onLoadComplete()
        Called after all controllers in and under phantom have loaded. This is invoked by phantom.

      • onPluginsComplete

        void onPluginsComplete()
        Called after all plugins have started and the server is active

      • register

        void register(Controller c)
        Register a subcontroller of this controller By registering a subcontroller to this controller THIS controller will start/stop the registrant when THIS controller start/stops
        Parameters:
        c - the registrant

      • getPlugin

        ControllablePlugin getPlugin()
        Get the root controller plugin (your plugin)
        Returns:
        the plugin

      • getParentController

        Controllable getParentController()
        Get the parent controller. This controller may be a sub controller of another controller or controllable plugin.
        Returns:
        the parent controller or null if this is a controllable plugin since a plugin does not have a parent controller

      • getName

        String getName()
        The name of this controller. The name is effectivley class.getSimpleName()
        Returns:
        the name

      • getControllers

        GList<Controllable> getControllers()
        Get all subcontrollers of this controller. Modifying this causes unexpected functionality
        Returns:
        a list of controllers

      • getController

        Controllable getController(String name)
        Get any controller on the server by name. This allows you to get controllers from other plugins on the same server even if it is not in your classpath. You can then send this controller a message in a datacluster format to transfer data back and fourth. It is much faster than reflection.
        Parameters:
        name - the controller name (class.getSimpleName)
        Returns:
        the controller or null if not found
